Novels.title: Summer Fun
Novels.content: An novel in letters about a trans woman who lives in [New Mexico|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Truth_or_Consequences,_New_Mexico] and who is a real true fan of a certain band. Forthcoming, Soho Press, 2021.

Novels.title: The Dream of Doctor Bantam
Novels.content: In mourning after the suicide of her sister, a young woman takes a job as a housekeeper for her crush, who belongs to a cult that does not believe in linear time. Lambda Literary Award Finalist. OR Books, 2012.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: The Black Emerald
The Black Emerald (stories).content: A troubled teenager discovers a haunted stone in the closet of an underground cartoonist, which gives her a terrifying power. Written 2010.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Staying up for Days in the Chelsea Hotel
Energy Arcs and Fractal Skies
The Black Emerald (stories).content: A man projects himself into the walls of his girlfriend's apartment. [Evergreen Review|https://evergreenreview.com/] 1.122, March 2010.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Tomato Plants
The Black Emerald (stories).content: How are we to care for other lives? Medulla Review 2.2, March 2011.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Putrefying Lemongrass
The Black Emerald (stories).content: A tourist couple attempts to pick up a trans woman at a Vietnamese restaurant in exchange for dessert. [CURA|http://curamag.com/] #14, 2014.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Chairs
The Black Emerald (stories).content: How one adapts to prohibitions. Santa Clara Review/Fiction Circus, Spring 2006/March 2008.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Satan in Love
The Black Emerald (stories).content: A young woman is pursued by the devil, who is every other human person. Pushcart nominee. [A Capella Zoo|http://acapellazoo.com], Spring 2010.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Skeleton
The Black Emerald (stories).content: A young woman forms a special relationship with a skeleton her shitty boyfriend gives her as a gift. [Night Train|http://www.nighttrainmagazine.com/], September 2008.

The Black Emerald (stories).title: Myra's Seven Conversations
The Black Emerald (stories).content: The emotionally unavailable owner of a bed and breakfast offers a conversation service for women who want to fall in love with her. Written 2011.

Uncollected Fiction.title: Nine Bedrooms
Uncollected Fiction.content: A description of nine bedrooms. Forthcoming, Epiphany Magazine, 2019.

Uncollected Fiction.title: The Fountainhead
Uncollected Fiction.content: The teenage fan of a problematic novelist-philosopher works at an office supply store. Evergreen Review 2.3, March 2019.

Uncollected Fiction.title: White People Anonymous
Uncollected Fiction.content: A trans woman is required to join a twelve-step group for white women in theory attempting to recover from their own racism. [n+1|https://nplusonemag.com/online-only/online-only/white-people-anonymous], March 2018.

Uncollected Fiction.title: Angels Are Here to Help You
Uncollected Fiction.content: In a mysterious future, one trans woman and her famous cat set out for the stars to start an import/export company for space drugs. In Meanwhile, Elsewhere, Topside: 2017.

Uncollected Fiction.title: The L7 Gene
Uncollected Fiction.content: On returning home for Thanksgiving, a trans woman learns that her mother has created a cis clone of her. [WIRED|https://www.wired.com/2016/12/thornton-on-its-way-to-close/], January 2017.

Uncollected Fiction.title: Tipping Point
Uncollected Fiction.content: An actor approaches some trans women with a Proposition. [WSQ|https://www.feministpress.org/books-n-z/wsq-queer-methods], Fall/Winter 2016.

Uncollected Fiction.title: Red Velvet LLC
Uncollected Fiction.content: Two trans folks attempt to start a bakery company. Twitter Fiction Festival, 2015. Made with [Twine|http://twinery.org/]!

Uncollected Fiction.title: Vampire Book Tour
Uncollected Fiction.content: Clearly totally fictional story about vampires. Pushcart nominee. In Where We're Going We Don't Need Roads, Topside: 2014.

Nonfiction.title: Quid Pro Quo, Just Like That
Nonfiction.content: About transitioning while working in publishing. Tales of Two Cities, OR Books/Viking: 2014/2016.

Depreciated.content: Temple of Zuul. Prick of the Spindle 4.4, Spring 2011.
The New Hat. Ampersand Review, Spring 2010.
The Apotheosis of Tommy Clay. Bartleby-Snopes, April 2009.
On Becoming a Machine. Apocalypse Magazine, February 2007.

Comics.title: We're Still Here
Comics.content: The first all-trans comics anthology (as far as we know!) Editor, with Tara Madison Avery. Lambda Literary Award finalist; Ignatz Award nominee. 2018.

Comics.title: Diary Comix
Comics.content: Mostly drawn on the subway to work. 2016-present.

Comics.title: Bad Mother
Comics.content: A young queer woman and her pals raise a child to take on the world. 2012-2016.

Comics.title: The Man Who Hates Fun
Comics.content: The heavily crosshatched adventures of a Stoic philosopher and his long-suffering pals. 2004-2012, mostly: I draw new ones sometimes.

Comics.title: Diary of a Ghost Girl
Comics.content: A teen falls in love with her own diary. Never completed. 2010-2012.

Games.title: Capitalism 1
Games.content: A short game about what capitalism is like. [Construct2|https://www.scirra.com/], 2014.

Games.title: Capitalism Zero: Crisis in the Stars
Games.content: An ongoing game project about a strange dream. VERY in progress. HTML/CSS/JS, 2018-present.

Games.title: Capitalism 2: Planet of the Death Dragons
Games.content: You and your pal will definitely get the better of capitalism this time. [Construct2|https://www.scirra.com/], 2014-present (unfinished).

Games.title: Immortal Defense
Games.content: A weird tower defense game based on ideas about immortality + violence in games. Just the story. I was very young! [Studio Eres|http://www.studioeres.com/], Gamemaker, 2007.

Publishing.title: Instar Books
Publishing.content: Current obsession, run with my long-time pal [Miracle Jones|http://miraclejones.com]. We publish three kinds of things: (a) trans literature, (b) digital experiments, (c) fiction by troubled people. All books must be at least one and ideally more than one. Our best-selling titles are [Videogames for Humans|http://instarbooks.com/books/videogames-for-humans.html], [Nerve Endings: The New Trans Erotic|http://www.instarbooks.com/books/nerve-endings.html], and [Invasions|http://www.instarbooks.com/books/invasions.html], but [see them all]. 2014-ongoing.

Publishing.title: Freelance Editorial
Publishing.content: For years I made my living doing freelance editorial work for [various|http://greenleafbookgroup.com] [clients|http://stackeddeckpress.com]. For the most part I did line editing, copyediting, and manuscript evaluation, but sometimes book design, proofreading, and indexing as well. I haven't been taking steady clients since 2018 due to my day job, but you never know: [email me|mailto:jwthornton@gmail.com] for info about services and rates?

Publishing.title: Rocksalt Magazine
Publishing.content: After having to leave publishing in 2011 I was sad for a while and wanted to do some kind of large publishing project. [Rocksalt Magazine|http://fictioncircus.com/rocksalt/], with copublisher [Geoff Sebesta|http://unnecessaryg.com/] was the result. Mostly Austin-based comics and visual art, print circulation of 6,000, distributed by [Motorblade|http://motorblade.com/]. A wonderful time.

About.content:
Jeanne Thornton is the author of a bunch of things listed on this site. She is one of the recipients of the [Judith A Markowitz Emerging Writers Award|https://www.lambdaliterary.org/emerging-writer-award/], as well as a [Lambda Literary|http://lambdaliterary.org] Fellow and a three-time Lambda Literary Award finalist. She is one of the publishers of [Instar Books|http://www.instarbooks.com].

She is sometimes available for freelance work, [please inquire|mailto:jwthornton@gmail.com]!
